Reviews.Title: piece of junk!
Reviews.Author: potential customer
Reviews.Content: If I could give this phone "zero" stars, then I would.  Like everyone else said, this is a piece of junk that shuts itself off repeatedly.  I put up with all of the other issues, but turning itself off is the nail in the coffin.  The battery is charged, the phone sitting on my desk, and it just turns off.  I type a text, hit send, and it turns off about 30% of the time -- usually without saving the text.  I'm in the middle of a phone call and it just stops sending my voice to the other person.  (I have to admit that my children like that feature!)I only use it as a phone, to send texts, and to take an occasional picture.  I've never used it online.FYI -- T-Mobile doesn't consider the phone randomly turning off to be a problem.  Rather, it's a selling opportunity for a new phone.

Reviews.Title: Wish I Had My Other Phone Back
Reviews.Author: Apollos
Reviews.Content: I got this phone a few months ago and have had almost nothing but trouble with it.First of all, there are too many keys and functions all crammed tightly together in way too small of a device. One gremlin showed up soon after I got it. I carry the phone in my jeans pocket. It rings and I reach down and take it out of my pocket, put it up to my ear, and before I even say "Hello," someone is saying that to me: "Hello?" "Hello?" It happens all of the time. What's happening is, the key that you push to answer the phone has already been pushed while the phone is still in my pocket, and the caller is already on the line. It gets pushed somewhere in the process of reaching down into my pocket, taking the phone into my hand, and taking it out of my pocket to answer it. This is VERY annoying.The second negative issue I've had is with the keypad lock function. When I first got the phone and was getting used to the keypad, if I was looking down at a phone number and entering it, if I waited longer than 2 or 3 seconds to push the next key down, the automatic keypad lock had turned on right in the middle of entering a phone number. So I had to push the menu key twice, then push the tiny "joy stick" key to get it unlocked, and then resume dialing. Again, VERY annoying. So I turned off the locking function. But then I started hearing electronic tones of keys being pressed while the phone was in my pocket, so I had to turn the keypad lock function back on. But some time later, something happened, and it went from 2 or 3 seconds to lock up, to a full 30 seconds before it will lock again. So now, when I finish a call, I have to wait 30 seconds before I put the phone back in my pocket or else keys will be punched and entered into the phone again during the first 30 seconds that it's in my pocket. I HATE THIS PHONE!Also, the volume control lever/button is not in a good place. It happens to be right where I grip the side of the phone. So sometimes I'm having trouble hearing someone during a call and I quickly check the volume and find that it has gone down to 2 or 3, simply because of where I'm gripping the side of the phone.Again -- too many keys and functions too close together means all kinds of "opportunities" for things to go wrong. The pull-out QWERTY keyboard has keys so tiny, it takes me forever to punch each one to send a text message, to keep from constantly straddling keys. Changing over from the special function keys to regular keys, and vice versa, is a real drag, too.I very much regret getting this phone and wish I had my old one back now; it was so simple to use. But I wanted to start texting and was told that I couldn't do it on that phone.This Gravity Text phone is too small for my big hands, but the larger phones are way out of my price range. Looks like I'm stuck with it.

Reviews.Title: Bad phone- keep shutting off
Reviews.Author: polarbearpilot
Reviews.Content: THis phone is the worst phone I've had, well 2nd worst phone. The worst one was the first cell phone I got over 15 years ago.  This one keeps shutting ifself off randomly. It happens when I have it in my purse, when I have in my pocket, when I have it on the table, even when I make a call.  HATE IT. HATE IT HATE IT.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Gravity TXT T379
Reviews.Author: ema
Reviews.Content: Mouse in middle takes a while with which to become familiar/comfortable.  Some problems with texting and space key.  I really liked my old (original) Gravity, but this one is lighter and has a 'conversation' mode for texting which makes it easier to recall what was said last and to whom.  Also, the internet service is easier to use and the display is better than the old model.  It has a nice size - wish it had more ring tones and this one doesn't seem to have a way to record sounds.  More problems the longer I have owned this - it randomly goes out on me.  A Samsumg Touch I bought for my daughter (new) was so faulty that we finally just trashed it.  This one is on its way out, already.  I won't be buying Samsung in any electronic device in future.  Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Gravity TXT
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE WORST PHONE I HAVE EVER OWNED. I power my phone off about once a day. (My carrier, T-Mobile, says this makes the phone work better.) Periodically I can't make a call because the phone displays "Emergency calls only". After a few times having this happen I powered the phone down and back up again. I called T-Mobile and they said that is what I need to do. There may be a software problem but the indication was that it would not be fixed. Another problem I have is I will receive the notice that I have a phone message and the phone has been sitting arms length away from me and did not ring. This happened the other day sitting in my game room with windows along one side that I can see a cell site sitting at my desk. The cell site is visible thru the tree leaves (this is mid March - leaves are small). I was told that the leaves could have caused the problem. At home my phone always shows 5 bars of reception.

Reviews.Title: A phone with two serious issues. Not worth keeping.
Reviews.Author: B. Sharma
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst phone I have ever owned. As some of the other people reported in there reviews, it has two serious issues. First, it keeps dropping off the network randomly. Screen displays the message - 'emergency calls only'. You need to reboot the phone to recover. Second, it randomly keeps turning off. Basically, the phone could be out of service when you need it. I have tried two phones. Identical problems. Seem like basic design issues. I have given up on this phone. I'll be replacing it with some other kind of phone.

Reviews.Title: Worst phone I have ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Russ in Oregon
Reviews.Content: Going all the way back to my Motorola Flip Phone, this is the absolute worst phone I have ever owned.  First, you shouldn't have to go to the owners manual to set a ring tone.  The phone randomly disconnects from the network and I have to reboot the phone to get the network back.  When this happened on the first one, I took it back.  The second one does it too.  Big deal?  If I don't notice that the 'T-Mobile' has been replaced by 'searching' I go through the day missing all my calls.  When I try to make a call, the screen displays 'emergency calls only'.  When I reboot to get back on the network I see my mailbox has all the messages that have been piling up while I believed my phone to be connected.The battery meter is next to useless.  It shows as fully charged for 95% of the charge.  When the meter drops one of the bars, there is only about 2-3 hours of idle time left before it shuts off.  How about a progressive meter that declines in relation to the percentage of battery life left?

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Mark V. Epelbaum "Mordechi"
Reviews.Content: Works great has the optical track pad easy to use the keyboard is smooth with extra large keys. Poped in my SIM and was talking and texting right away. Price is great will buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: angelbells
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 14 year old son and he loves it. Great option if you want an up to date durable phone.

Reviews.Content: Just responding to Mr. Nick review about overpriced, the above comments about overpriced are misguiding, price $19.99 are with 2 year contract and upgrade price. so please don't misguide people Mr. Nick.

Reviews.Title: I hate this phone!!!  It turns itself off randomly multiple times a day.
Reviews.Author: C. Parker
Reviews.Content: I really hate my phone.  The biggest complaint is that when I push send to send a text it sometimes turns itself off.  It also turns itself off randomly throughout the day and when I pick it up thinking I haven't had any calls for a while I find out why.  It was off.  I also have the problem of dialing a number, hitting send and then it goes back to the main screen like nothing happened and I wasn't trying to make a call.  I think it hates me too. ;)  It's mutual.  This is the second exact phone I have had this problem with.  I had my orginal version of this for a few months and the day I took it home it started doing this.  I must be really patient because I put up with it for several months until I finally went back into the store to have them replace it and send me a new one thinking it was just a fluke.  Nope.  Just an awlful phone.  The second one does the same thing.  Now I have to figure out which is a bigger pain - sticking with the phone I hate or finding a way to get T-Mobile to take back my phone without making me pay for it.  Sucks.

Reviews.Title: Gravity TXT is a terrible phone
Reviews.Author: Draconis
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this phone to my ex wife!It is all the problems Apollos wrote about and more.After less than 9 months of careful use, the phone turns itself off intermittently and now the screen goes blank when I open the slider to use the keyboard.This is not an isolated problem. Both my wife's and my identical phones started doing the same thing within a week of each other.Run away!

Reviews.Title: Peace Of Junk!!!!
Reviews.Author: Albert Fabrizi
Reviews.Content: Do not buy phone .  Screen stop working 3 months after purchase. Owned 2 of these phones both had problems with screen.

Reviews.Title: Worst phone ever created.
Reviews.Author: Quem
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for a year and a half and I have no idea why I put up with it for so long.  I really don't expect that much of my phone.Things I do not expect my phone to do:--Access the Internet--Download apps--Give me directions--Play videos--Become a lightsaberThings I do expect my phone to do:--Call people and stay connected.--Text people--Tell me what time it is--Tell me how much battery life it has--Do things when I press buttonsNotice that the things I expect my phone to do are only the most basic functions that all phones should be able to do by default—no more, no less.  This phone spectacularly failed to do every single one of the basic functions that phones are supposed to do.  Here's how:1. Call people:  As others have stated, this phone randomly shuts off when I try to make a call.  This happens quite frequently, and when it happens, it takes several minutes for the phone to reboot and initialize.  I have also had the problem of my audio shutting off in the middle of a call, so that I can still hear the person on the other end, but he/she can't hear me.2. Text people:  Same problem with shutting off when I attempt to send a text.  Moreover, as others have pointed out, the keyboard is very cumbersome for texting.  I actually wouldn't mind this because I have gotten so used to texting with the number pad that I can do it just as fast, EXCEPT the dictionary has the vocabulary of a seven-year-old which leads me to have to resort to the keyboard anyway for many multi-syllabic words.  (I have a $25 pre-paid phone with a better dictionary, but I guess the makers of this phone expected everyone to use the keyboard, so they did not bother to work on number pad texting at all.)3. Tell me what time it is:  The time display often freezes on one time, so I have to slide it open to make it update to the actual time.  The phone did not update for Daylight Savings Time until 24 hours after it was supposed to.  If I had used my phone's alarm, I would have woken up late for a very important Sunday morning appointment.  Fortunately I knew better than to trust this piece of junk.4. Tell me how much battery life it has:  As others have mentioned, the battery life bar may show the phone as fully charged (five bars) for days, but once it goes down to four bars, you have hours before it dies.  This, of course, renders the battery life bar completely useless and is in fact worse than if the bar were not there at all.5. Do things when I press buttons:  Sometimes, inexplicably, every button on the phone will freeze completely, leaving me incapable of doing anything whatsoever.  The only way I could figure out to fix it was to mash all of the buttons on the keyboard as much as possible until it woke up.I almost never write reviews, but 2 stars is much too kind for this abomination, and I'd like to see this phone get the 1-star average it deserves.  Don't let T-Mobile pull this garbage on you—demand a better phone.

Reviews.Content: just prior to this phone got one from u had problems ..had to return it didn't appreciate paying postage back as it was adverted as excellent shape..memorie slot unusable..did get credit..except for my postage...this phone,,delivered faster than I expected.works wonderful..as usual a great experience..the last phone was the first problem in many purchases..have to expect sometime..still didn't appreciate back postage..excellent condition in my book means no problems ..maybe the seller reads different books...will be right back for my next need..thanks amazon for the prompt response and credit....

Reviews.Content: This is the worst phone you could buy.  I would recommend 2 cans and a string over this piece of junk1. The phone randomly turns off2. When you turn the phone back on, the contacts take 10 minuets to "initialize"3. The optical joystick is unusable4. Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE!!!
Reviews.Author: Reuben Behm
Reviews.Content: I don't often write reviews but I just want to make sure this phone gets the bad publicity it deserves for the benefit of  the prospective buyer.  I have the same issues as everyone else in this forum.  Drops service without any notification.  Phone powers off randomly. And I might add that the optical joystick is not a joy to use.  DON'T GET THIS PHONE!!!!

Reviews.Title: AVOID AT ALL COST
Reviews.Author: JOEY MILLER
Reviews.Content: This phone is the the worst phone I have ever had/seen. I got this thing for free with a two year contract because I don't use a phone enough two want a android or iphone or anything around that price. I had for five months and the lcd screen broke, so I had to pay 20$ to get a new one, no big deal, then the new one's lcd screen breaks again five months later, this time t-mobile and samsung won't help unless I pay 75$ to fix it. Why would I pay that when I can get a better phone for around the same price. So two phones two broken lcd screens and me calling and being on hold for this thing. Other then that everything else you see on other people's reviews is true. Annoying mouse thing,locking issues, dropping calls, sound issues. My phone would randomly during a conversion I can here the other person talk, but they can't hear me. Last time I get anything samsung makes. Spend the extra money and at least get something that does suck as bad as this thing.

Reviews.Title: Worst phone ever.
Reviews.Author: Lisa Moore
Reviews.Content: I have been so unhappy with this phone.  And now that I read all the reviews on it I can see I'm not alone!  It's actually kind of nice to see that I'm not the only one whose phone just turns off randomly.  I've missed important phone calls and texts because I assume I'll hear my phone ringing, but no, IT'S TURNED ITSELF OFF!  And I'll turn it back on and see that it's fully charged.  I also keep it locked so no accidentally hitting the off button is happening.  I guess it's time to bite the bullet and fork out the money for a decent phone.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Phone
Reviews.Author: Karen Bernal
Reviews.Content: This phone I bought lasted for while and then my screen turned white and then the second time I bought this phone it lasted about 2 1/2 months and then when I accepted phone calls I couldn't hear the other person the next day my screen would turn white until I closed it and then later on it completed turned white! Worse phone ever do not recommend! Don't waste your money

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Forrest Davis "Forrest"
Reviews.Content: Good Phone. Not too fancy, durable. The thing in the middle used for control is a little finicky. But a good phone for texting.

Reviews.Title: Speaker is muffled and sounds like you are in a tunnel.  Hard to deal with company.  Not getting anywhere
Reviews.Author: Beth Teas
Reviews.Content: The speaker on the phone is muffled and sounds like you are in a tunnel.  I have tried to deal with the company that I ordered the phone through on Amazon.  The company's name is BREED.  I am not getting anywhere and seems like I am stuck with a phone that sounds terrible..

Reviews.Title: terrible phone, terrible service
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for 1 year and 2 months ago for my husband and we have not liked it from the beginning, unfortunately I didn't realize it in time to cancel my TMobile contract and give back the phone.It constantly has "failed" texts and I always have people telling me that they sent a text and it turns out we didn't receive it.  My children also use this phone to contact me that they are safe at home and half of the days the text does not go through and I am then left to call while I am at work to make sure they are ok.  This number one fail is a HUGE safety issue for me and completely unacceptable in a phone or a phone companies service.Their are to many buttons, to close together and it is confusing on how to do most things even if you have the manual and have had the phone for over a year.This phone would not even be recommended for a teenager it is so bad with texting.It is very frustrating and not worth the money I pay every month.I can't change my contract without being penalized, I can't upgrade the phone without being penalized, I can't cancel the contract without being penalized.This is a terrible phone and TMobile has the worst plans and customer support.  My advise is to stay with the company you are with and learn to be happy with an extra fee here or there vs this company or phone.

Reviews.Title: awful
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: broke down completely after 3 months - first the ring sound disappeared; then stopped receiving cell signal.samsung should not be putting their name on such products.

Reviews.Title: I HATE THIS PHONE!!!
Reviews.Author: LDR "LDR"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone two years ago because it was only a dollar with a two-year contract.  Big mistake.  Its stiff, itty, bitty keys are too close together, which makes texting slow and cumbersome.  The phone also turns itself off randomly and often displays an "emergency calls only" message (I have to reboot in order to make calls when it does that).  The worse thing, though, is that I randomly lose service.  Often my phone is on but I can't make or receive calls.  Then a bunch of calls will randomly appear in my voice mail box.  Sometimes a call or text will appear a day or two after it was sent, even though I've used the phone in the interim.  Last night I was standing on my front step trying to make a call (I can usually start a call there and then go inside after I get a connection.  If that doesn't work, I stand by my back gate) but it didn't work.  I tried four different times, and then a text came in from the day before.  I tried to respond to it and the phone couldn't get a connection.  And then something snapped inside of me.  I  don't care what it costs,  I am buying myself an I-Phone this afternoon and when I get home I'm going to flush my Gravity TXT down the toilet.

Reviews.Title: This phone is horrible!
Reviews.Author: al2l3ie8
Reviews.Content: I got this phone about a month ago, and it has been driving me CRAZY! It shuts off at random times, loses service quickly, loses battery quickly, is difficult to text on because of the size of the keys, takes bad pictures, etc. I really would not recommend this phone to anyone. It's just a dumb phone and it's not worth your money!

Reviews.Title: Great... for kids
Reviews.Author: seb9927
Reviews.Content: I just got this phone and i love it. I think this is a great phone for kids because there is alot of buttons on the keypad for texting like there's a button for emoticons all in all great product

Reviews.Title: Worst Phone Ever
Reviews.Author: SuzieQ
Reviews.Content: I got this phone about a year ago because I wanted a phone with a Qwerty Pad.  I also wasn't ready to pay huge amounts of money for a smartphone.  This phone constantly dials back the last number received or dialed.  I don't even have to be in the same room for it to do this.  I have had many people text me to tell me that they can hear every word i'm saying.  Luckily I wasn't talking about that person.  I brought the phone to TMobile and all they said was they were aware of that issue with other phones but not this one.  They told me to make sure to lock it.  They said if that didn't work to bring it in and they can restore it to factory settings.  However I would loose any saved stuff.  Screw it.  I made sure to lock it.  That works 95% of the time. That's it.  Then I recently started having the issue of the phone rebooting everytime I text, or randomly shutting itself off. ARGHHHHHHHHHHHHHH. Don't waste your money.  It is a piece of junk.  Try a tin can and a string.  Less hassle.

Reviews.Content: First attempt with this Gravity TXT modelPhone slider is harder to use than older models.The finger slide button often overshoot and will require extra attempts to get the icon you want.Emails are bundled by conversation and are more difficult to find that last email you wanted.Phone stopped charging and needed to be returned.
